A few hours laterÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s never one cata-ataclysmic failure, but rather a series of small-aller failings that ultimately culminate in disaster-er. And I was-as a part of this fail-ailure.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“But you tried to fix it. You arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t bad.Ã¢â‚¬Â

ANSI/Stanley: Ã¢â‚¬Å“If I werenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t, then IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d have recovered the situat-ation.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Even the best of us slip up from time to time. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s just part of life. In this case, though, it wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t a good outcome from anyoneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s perspective.Ã¢â‚¬Â

ANSI/Stanley: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Do you feel responsible, Jeb?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I was their captain, Stanley, and I wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t here to do a damn thing about it. Had I not been so set on exploring Laythe, I might have been able to help save the others.Ã¢â‚¬Â

ANSI/Stanley: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I feel responsible, Jeb. I was install-alled to ensure the mission didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t wind up like this.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And you did everything you could to try and meet that goal. I doubt that, without you on the ship, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d not even have made it beyond Moho.Ã¢â‚¬Â

A moments pause takes hold.

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t understand.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Then-en thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s the crippling system errors and bugs that are preventing-ing the smooth operation of the ship that IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m supposed to have runn-nning like a well-oiled machine. I think, put simply, you would be better off without me being active.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Stanley, you were always one for optimism. What happened?Ã¢â‚¬Â

ANSI/Stanley: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Everything.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“EverythingÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ hmph. Alright, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to say this now; donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t make any rash decisions, Stanley. There are people back home who jump to conclusions all the time when they think theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re cornered with no ultimate escape from whatever it is that supposedly got them in that corner in the first place. ANSI/Stanley: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t make rash decisions, Jeb. I thought you knew me better than that.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d like to think I know you tremendously well, Stanley, which is why IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m trying to help you see that shutting down is probably not the good idea youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re thinking it may be right now.Ã¢â‚¬Â
